rules.ruleString: Must be enrolled in course version {2309, M6010}

unitName: Regulation and ethics in assisted reproductive technologies
description: This unit examines the current legislation and regulations governing the clinical practice of Assisted Reproductive Technologies (ART) and related research, nationally and internationally. It describes the role of ethical frameworks and principles in health decision-making and analyses regulation in ART with respect to underlying moral and ethical principles. An introduction to ethical problem solving is presented. The major ethical issues raised by assisted reproductive technologies are examined and critically evaluated.
faculty: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences
